Hi!

I have a class with a private constructor whose methods I want to 
test. I cannot create an instance of this class in my test class as 
its constructor is private. 

I used JUnitX from extreme java as it would allow to test private and 
protected java classes, but I am still getting an access problem. 
Doesn't JUnitX circumvent the access levels and create an instance of 
the class?

-Saritha.
